alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 19 at 7:56PM MST until August 19 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Northeastern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 900 PM MST. * At 755 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 21 miles northwest of Sundad to near Harcuvar to 14 miles southwest of Alamo Lake, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 23 and 67. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 67. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 19 and 49. Locations impacted include... Salome, Brenda, Wenden, Vicksburg, Bouse, Harcuvar and Palm Canyon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
